#Text=George Gordon , 5th
#Text=Earl of Huntly
#Text=George Gordon , 5th Earl of Huntly
#Text=( died 19 October 1576 ) , was Lord Chancellor of Scotland and major conspirator of his time .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Second son of the 4th Earl , he was Sheriff of Inverness from 1556 .
#Text=As Captain of Badenoch , he was in charge of carrying letters sent from Edinburgh to Mary of Guise in Inverness from Dunkeld throughout the summer of 1556 . [ 1 ]
#Text=Mary , Queen of Scots
#Text=came north to reduce the power of the Gordons and take Inverness Castle in 1562 .
#Text=The Earl was captured at Corrichie with his other sons , John Gordon and Adam Gordon , and the Earl suddenly died .
#Text=John , the eldest , was executed three days later .
#Text=George ( called Lord Gordon ) was imprisoned at Kinneil House . [ 2 ]
#Text=He was attainted and sentenced to death for treason in 1563 .
#Text=He was then imprisoned at Dunbar castle until the marriage of Queen Mary to Darnley in 1565 , when his lands and dignities were nominally restored . [ 3 ]
#Text=He allied himself with James Hepburn , 4th Earl of Bothwell , who was married to his sister Jean , and joined Queen Mary at Dunbar after Rizzio ' s murder in 1566 .
#Text=He became Lord Chancellor of Scotland in 1567 , and joined Bothwell in the plot to murder the Regent Moray at Jedburgh .
#Text=He signed the bond at Craigmillar Castle for Darnley 's murder , and accompanied Bothwell and Mary on the visit to Darnley before his murder .
#Text=His estates were fully restored after Bothwell 's acquittal in 1567 .
#Text=Bothwell 's divorce from his sister was facilitated by his influence over her , and he witnessed the marriage contract between Mary and Bothwell .
#Text=He connived at the capture of the Queen , and accompanied her to Edinburgh , escaping to the north after her flight .
#Text=He joined the partisans at Dumbarton Castle , and after a temporary agreement with Regent Moray he conspired for her deliverance from Loch Leven Castle in 1567 .
#Text=After the Queen 's escape to England in 1568 , he held all the north in alliance with Argyll , but received Mary 's order to disperse .
#Text=Huntly made an agreement with Regent Moray at St Andrews on 14 May 1569 .
#Text=Huntly was to make up his quarrel with the Earl of Morton , repress rebellion amongst his former allies , and surrender a royal cannon kept at Huntly Castle .

#Text=In return , Regent Moray would give the Earl and his followers a remission for all their crimes against the King since 11 June 1567 , and promised an Act of Parliament to forgive his role as ' pretended Lieutenant to the Queen 's Grace ' between August 1568 and March 1569 . [ 4 ]
#Text=After this temporary submission , continuing the Marian civil war , he gained possession of Edinburgh Castle , held a parliament , and captured Regent Lennox at Stirling .
#Text=His brother Adam Gordon of Auchindoun was his lieutenant in the north , and fought for Queen Mary in Aberdeenshire and the Mearns .
#Text=In 1572 the Earl came to terms with the Regent Morton .
#Text=He died at Strathbogie , four years later .
#Text=An eyewitness description of his death , compiled by Richard Bannatyne describes how he suffered a stroke , or a collapse caused by food-poisoning , while playing football .
#Text=After the Earl died a number of alleged supernatural events occurred beginning with the sudden collapse of one of the servants .
#Text=Three companions also collapsed and when revived complained of feeling cold .
#Text=After the Earl 's body was embalmed and taken to the chapel , his brother sat in the hall and heard unexplained sounds from the earl 's chamber . [ 5 ]
#Text=Family
#Text=He married Anne , daughter of James Hamilton , Duke of Châtellerault and had a daughter Jean , and his successor , George Gordon , 6th Earl of Huntly . [ 6 ]
